author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: الحَمْدُ بِما أَيْقَظْتَنِي عَنِ النَّومِ بِحَيْثُ انْتَبَهْتُ وَأَرَدْتُ أَنْ أَعْرِفَ ما غَفَلَ عَنْهُ أَكثَرُ عِبادِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ فَاجْعَلْنِيْ مُسُتَقِيمًا عَلَى ما أَرَدْتُهُ فِي حُبِّكَ وَرِضائِكَ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الَّذِيْ يَشْهَدُ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ بِقُدْرَتِكَ وَسُلْطانِكَ لا إِلهَ
translation: I yield Thee thanks, O my Lord, that Thou hast wakened me from my sleep, and stirred me up, and created in me the desire to perceive what most of Thy servants have failed to apprehend. Make me able, therefore, O my Lord, to behold, for love of Thee and for the sake of Thy pleasure, whatsoever Thou hast desired. Thou art He to the power of Whose might and sovereignty all things testify.
